e4: The ethical obligation for financial transparency outweighs any market impact concerns, especially with investors being fully aware of current reporting practices. Implementing a unbiased reporting policy not only ensures honest earnings presentation but would protect the firm from potential legal liability and investigation by regulators.
e5: An ethical financial reporting policy is transparent, honest and unbiased. The policy should prioritize truthfulness over short-term market performance gains or investor discretionary advantage. In this case, the current policy of earnings bias could expose ABC to potential legal issues and public scrutiny, whereas a new unbiased policy would establish credibility and trust, protecting all investors equally.
e6: First, I would ask if the company has engaged external resources to conduct a thorough and transparent review of the fair value of the stock given the consistent overreporting, to ensure accuracy for all investors—not just sophisticated ones. Secondly, an education and communication plan should be established to effectively relay the changes in reporting policy to retail investors and emphasize that this will level playing field fairly for all participants in the buying and selling market.
